intro: Harpalyce flexuosa, commonly known as the curlyleaf harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Harpalyce flexuosa is adapted to withstand drought and has a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh conditions.
